ygData.subject: Re: Advice
ygData.msgSnippet: what i mainly meant about north Ro is the dervishes provide ample exp. but it can be hard at lower levels because people will killsteal from you... ... From:
ygData.messageBody:
what i mainly meant about north Ro is the dervishes provide ample exp. but
it can be hard at lower levels because people will killsteal from you...
-----Original Message-----
From: Vincent Archer <Vincent.Archer@...>
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Date: Tuesday, May 18, 1999 1:05 AM
Subject: Re: [eq_wizards] Advice


>From: Vincent Archer <Vincent.Archer@...>
>
>According to Neil Lambert:
>> the level 8 does over 40! not to mention other spells. but the wizard
really
>> starts coming into power at level 12. you get your money making spell
(many
>> people will flame me for this) which is Bind Affinity. and you're new
spell
>
>Grumble :)
>I do agree. Bind Affinity means for me that I'll travel more safely, as I
can
>bind me at a relatively safe location (be sure to check it very carefully
>beforehand. Many a wizard lost a full experience level when he discovered a
>hostile guarding near his bind point - die... reincarnate... mob jumps
you...
>die... and so on, til he leaves)
>
>> So that's about it. i'm sure once you realize how good the exp is in Ro
>
>The Sand scrarabs are hunted to extinction. Tarantulas are left alone
(people
>hate being poisoned), and mummies must be checked carefully: if you haven't
a
>cleric at hand, stay away, or suffer the rabies - for 30mn real time.
>
>I'm not sure about the occasional madman; the guards leave those guys
alone,
>so if you hunt them, you might get KOS (but then, *you* might be KOS
already).
>
>> you'll stay for a while then start exploring, maybe going to Felwithe (if
>> you can stay invis long enough to get to the docks in freeport.
>
>Anyone got luck into finding the hidden passageways? There is supposedly a
>secret passage from the docks to the side of the wall after East Gate, but
>all I've found is a red-conning dark elf that forced me to dive to recover
>my body :( .
>
>--
